nodes.bodyText: nit: space after comment symbol
all URls should follow the format, e.g. /<pathcomponent>

Please find 2 examples of the API URLs below:
{{oauth_scim_service_host}}/oauth-scim-service/users/{{USER_ID_VALUE}}/change_password
{{oauth_scim_service_host}}/oauth-scim-service/user/reset_password
We are considering {{oauth_scim_service_host}}/oauth-scim-service/ as the base URL.
So pathcomponent starts without slash.
The change_password API requires {{USER_ID_VALUE}} to be passed along with the URL so we
had to split the URL. The change_password API is split like following
Base URL: {{oauth_scim_service_host}}/oauth-scim-service/
AUTH_SERVICE: users/
User ID: {{USER_ID_VALUE}}
CHANGE_PASSWORD: /change_password
Once we append all these strings we get the URL for change_password
So where ever {{USER_ID_VALUE}} has to be used there we have to construct similar way.

option 1:
base URL can be:
 {{oauth_scim_service_host}}/oauth-scim-service
then auth service can be /users
and change password will be '/change_password'
you just have to remember to add a prefix of / before adding any path components.
option 2:
no start or end slashes, you would need to join your strings with a '/', i.e.
base URL: {{oauth_scim_service_host}}/oauth-scim-service
auth service users: users
change password: '/change_password'
String[] parts = { base_url, auth_service_users, user_id, change_password }; 
url = String.join("/", parts);

the way you are dividing the path is more complicated and not very reusable, you will eventually make a mistake a cause an error. Buy creating a pattern in the path and path components structure you that's easier to follow and expand.

The Base Url for all the apis is consider with / . To follow the approve that you gave we'll have to change all the base url of other servers also. Is it fine to keep it this way or change all the base urls?
